page.title: 12Farming - a gamekeepers year
page.content: In{Spring}the{gamekeeper}prepares for the years shooting by{penning} {pheasants}to lay eggs to be hatched. Birds are fed{special pellets to make {the eggs fertile.} During the Summer the young pheasants are reared and the gamekeeper spends much time carrying food and water to the young birds and watching for and destroying vermin.{In {Autumn the shooting season begins. The gamekeeper continues to feed the birds and completes his organisation of the shooting days. His main task is to recruit and organise teams of {beaters who raise the birds for the {guns.} The life of a gamekeeper is lonely, but healthy and rewarding. He develops a keen interest in the natural world and has much freedom to organise his daily programme of work. {Two gamekeepers are employed on the {Morningthorpe Estate.
